analyzed: zhes so // 'dir thab la sogs pa la ji ltar rigs par khyad par gzhan ni bdag gis 'od kyi snye ma dang dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rdo rje phreng bar rnam par spros so zhes 'dir rgyas par ma byas so // dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: Here, the other distinctions in the hearth and so forth as appropriate, I have elaborated in the Garland of Light Rays and the Ritual of the Mandala of Vajra Garland. I have not elaborated here.

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma nyi shu drug pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma nyi shu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the twenty-sixth chapter of the Instruction Garland, the commentary on the glorious Heruka's Tantra.

original: // / sngar dang de ma thag par yang sngags rnams kyi rjes su sgrub pa gsungs shing de yang thos nas /
analyzed: // / sngar dang de ma thag par yang sngags rnams kyi rjes su sgrub pa gsungs shing de yang thos nas /
translated: Having previously and immediately before this taught the practice of mantras, and having heard that,

analyzed: de rnams kyi btu ba la sogs pa ji ltar yin zhes dri ba /
translated: it is asked how their collection and so forth are done.

original: thos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words having heard and so forth.🔽

analyzed: don dam par shes pa'i phyir dang 'gro ba skyob pa'i phyir na don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems ni sngags te /

analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir aom yig la sogs pa yang sngags so //

analyzed: sngags su byed pa de kho na nyid bskul ba'i skad ces pa yang sngags so //

original: bye brag ni sngags gang cho ga gang gis gang du nye bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag ni sngags gang cho ga gang gis gang du nye bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: The distinction is the mantra, the rite, and the application.

analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes pa gsungs pa dang gsung bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi'o //

original: dkyil 'khor ni m'a ma k'i'i bha ga'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni m'a ma k'i'i bha ga'o //

analyzed: nyams dga' ba ni phul du dbyung du med pa'i bde ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de'i dbus su padma'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su padma'o //

analyzed: m'a ma k'i zhes pa ni rdo rje snyems ma la bod pa ste /
translated: The Māmakī is the Vajragarvā.

original: ring po nyid ni lung ngo //
analyzed: ring po nyid ni lung ngo //
translated: The long is the scripture.

original: lte ba ni rtsa kha ga mu kha'o //
analyzed: lte ba ni rtsa kha ga mu kha'o //
translated: The navel is the channel called avadhūtī.

analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad pa'i rtsa'i dbus na gnas pa nyid kyis na sbas pa ste yang dag par bsdams pa'o //

original: spyod yul ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: spyod yul ni bzhi ste /
translated: The field is fourfold:

original: der dbus kyi bug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: der dbus kyi bug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that is, the middle aperture.

original: dpa' bo ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: dpa' bo ni stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin bde ba chen po'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The hero is the thought of enlightenment, the nature of voidness, the essence of great pleasure.

original: yang dag btu bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag btu bar bya'o //
translated: One should extract it properly.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' gzhom du med pa n'a da'i ngo bor gyur pa'i dpa' bo de kho na 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' gzhom du med pa n'a da'i ngo bor gyur pa'i dpa' bo de kho na 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That hero, who is Vajrasattva, who is of the nature of the nada, is the one who accomplishes all desired aims, etc.

original: sde tshan ni brgyad rnams te /
analyzed: sde tshan ni brgyad rnams te /
translated: The group is the eight.

analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bor sngags ma lus pa 'byung @240b ba'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: They are the causes from which all mantras arise in the nature of the ali and kali.

original: de rnams kyi gzhom du med pa las skyes pa'i phyir dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzhom du med pa las skyes pa'i phyir dbang phyug go //
translated: He is the lord because he is born from the invincible.

original: 'dir ni rnal 'byor pa dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs can shes rab dang bcas pa phyag rgya drug gis brgyan pa skra grol ba phyogs kyi gos can /

original: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa la sogs pa'i sa phyogs bdud rtsi lngas nye bar byugs pa me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis yid 'phrog pa sha chen gyis bdug pa mar khu chen pos mar me sbar nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa la sogs pa'i sa phyogs bdud rtsi lngas nye bar byugs pa me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis yid 'phrog pa sha chen gyis bdug pa mar khu chen pos mar me sbar nas /
translated: The place, such as the maṇḍala house, is anointed with the five elixirs, and is captivating with flowers, and so on, and is perfumed with great meat, and a lamp is lit with great oil.

original: phyi rol du gar dang glu dang rol mo la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas cang te'u dang dril bu dkrol zhing gtor ma byin te /
analyzed: phyi rol du gar dang glu dang rol mo la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas cang te'u dang dril bu dkrol zhing gtor ma byin te /
translated: Having gone outside, having made offerings of dance, song, music, and so on, one should offer a bali, ringing a small drum and a bell.

original: dur khrod kyi so phag la sogs pa'i rdul tshon gyis padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi so phag la sogs pa'i rdul tshon gyis padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris la /
translated: Having drawn an eight-petaled lotus with dust from a charnel ground, and so on,

original: lte bar gzhom du med pa dang 'dab ma rnams la aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha'i rab tu dbye bas /
analyzed: lte bar gzhom du med pa dang 'dab ma rnams la aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha'i rab tu dbye bas /
translated: in the center is the invincible, and on the petals are the divisions of a ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śa.

original: sde tshan brgyad rnams mi mnyam pa med pa ma tshang ba med par bri bar bya'o zhes pa'i cho ga ni man ngag las so //
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad rnams mi mnyam pa med pa ma tshang ba med par bri bar bya'o zhes pa'i cho ga ni man ngag las so //
translated: The ritual of drawing the eight classes without omission and without inequality is from the esoteric instructions.

original: de nas sngags rnams btu ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags rnams btu ste /
translated: Then, the mantras are collected.

original: dang po'i sde pa'i gnyis pa'i sa bon yi ge ni a'a'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sde pa'i gnyis pa'i sa bon yi ge ni a'a'o //
translated: The seed syllable of the second of the first class is the syllable A.

original: stong pa ni 'dir zla ba phyed pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa ni 'dir zla ba phyed pa ste /
translated: The void here is the half-moon.

original: nam mkha'i rten gyi phyir nye bar btags pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rten gyi phyir nye bar btags pa'o //
translated: It is metaphorically designated as the support of space.

original: dgos pa ni sngags rnams thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis de'i rten can kho na las mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub ster ro zhes gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni sngags rnams thams cad ni stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis de'i rten can kho na las mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub ster ro zhes gsal bar bya'o //
translated: The purpose is to make it clear that all mantras, by being of one taste with emptiness, bestow the desired powers only from that as their support.

original: stong pa ni thig les so //
analyzed: stong pa ni thig les so //
translated: The void is the drop.

original: bco lnga pa ni thig le'o //
analyzed: bco lnga pa ni thig le'o //
translated: The fifteenth is the drop.

original: byang chub sa bon ni ha'o //
analyzed: byang chub sa bon ni ha'o //
translated: The seed of enlightenment is HA.

original: thams cad aom yig gis gsal cing //
analyzed: thams cad aom yig gis gsal cing //
translated: All are illuminated by the syllable OM,

original: sv'a h'a'i mtha' can sngags btu bya //
analyzed: sv'a h'a'i mtha' can sngags btu bya //
translated: and the mantra is collected with the end of SVAHA.

original: zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de'i phyir aom a'am lam ham sv'a h'a zhes pa spyan ma'i snying po'i sngags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir aom a'am lam ham sv'a h'a zhes pa spyan ma'i snying po'i sngags te /
translated: Therefore, the essence mantra of Locana is Om Ah Lam Ham Svaha.

original: aom zhes pa rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bsod nams len pa la'o //
analyzed: aom zhes pa rdo rje gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir bsod nams len pa la'o //
translated: Om is for the accumulation of merit, because it is the nature of the three vajras.

original: a'am zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas dga' ba bcu drug ro gcig pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: a'am zhes pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rigs pas dga' ba bcu drug ro gcig pa nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Ah is for joy, because it clarifies the single taste of the sixteen joys, as will be explained by reasoning.

original: lam ni 'dis rang bzhin nyid du gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: lam ni 'dis rang bzhin nyid du gsal bar byed do //
translated: Lam is for the natural, as will be explained.

original: ham ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ham ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Ham is for the supreme, as will be explained.

original: sv'a h'a zhes pa ni zhi ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sv'a h'a zhes pa ni zhi ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Svaha is for peace, as will be explained.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni au'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma ni au'o //
translated: Vajradaka is U.

original: nyi shu rtsa dgu pa ni ka'i yi ge la ltos nas so //🔽'og mar yang ji ltar rigs par aa nas bzung ste 'am /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa dgu pa ni ka'i yi ge la ltos nas so // 'og mar yang ji ltar rigs par aa nas bzung ste 'am /

original: ka nas brtsams te bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: ka nas brtsams te bgrang ba'o //
translated: Below that, as appropriate, count from A or from Ka.

original: goo r'i ni @241a * //
analyzed: goo r'i ni @241a * //
translated: Gaurī is I.

original: ai'o // gha sma r'i ni ao'o //
analyzed: ai'o // gha sma r'i ni ao'o //
translated: Ghasmarī is O.

original: tsoo r'i ni ae'o //
analyzed: tsoo r'i ni ae'o //
translated: Caurī is Ai.

analyzed: aom ru ru sphu ru dzva la ti shtha siddha lo tsa ne sv'a h'a zhes pa nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: Om, Ruru, Sphuru, Jvala, Tishtha, Siddha, Locana, Svaha.

original: ru ru zhes pa sngags kyi lha'i brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ru ru zhes pa sngags kyi lha'i brjod pa ste /
translated: Ruru is the utterance of the mantra deity.

original: ru sgra la'o //
analyzed: ru sgra la'o //
translated: It is the sound ru.

original: sphu ru ni cher gsal por gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: sphu ru ni cher gsal por gyis shig pa ste /
translated: Sphuru means shine forth greatly.

original: sbar rgyas pa la'o //
analyzed: sbar rgyas pa la'o //

original: dzva la ni shin tu gzi brjid can du 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dzva la ni shin tu gzi brjid can du 'gyur pa'o //
translated: Jvala means become very radiant.🔽Having fulfilled my hopes, remain.

analyzed: bdag gi re ba rdzogs par byas nas bzhugs shig / siddha ste gzhom du med pa'i lo tsa na ste spyan gang gi yin pa de la bod pa'o //
translated: Siddha means invincible, and locana means eye, that which has it.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su rdzogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su rdzogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of the Buddhas means of those perfected in the form of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyi btsun mo 'di'o zhes pas sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor las bya ba'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyi btsun mo 'di'o zhes pas sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor las bya ba'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This is the queen of Buddha Vairochana, thus indicating that this is to be done in the yoga of the Buddha.

original: sngags dang lha dag tha mi dad par mos pa las dngos grub bo zhes pas sngags kyang spyan zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngags dang lha dag tha mi dad par mos pa las dngos grub bo zhes pas sngags kyang spyan zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The power is from the conviction that the mantra and the deity are not different.

original: zhi ba bskyed ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba bskyed ma zhes pa'o //
translated: The mantra is called “the eye” because it generates peace.

original: las rnams thams cad sgrub byed ma //
analyzed: las rnams thams cad sgrub byed ma //
translated: It is the accomplisher of all activities

original: zhes pa las rnams thams cad zhi ba sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa las rnams thams cad zhi ba sngon ma can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because all activities are preceded by peace.

original: gzhan yang gtso bor zhi ba bskyed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang gtso bor zhi ba bskyed cing /
translated: Moreover, it primarily generates peace,

original: zhar las ni las thams cad sgrub ste /
analyzed: zhar las ni las thams cad sgrub ste /
translated: and it accomplishes all activities as a secondary result.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma la shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for the following mantras.

original: de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān has said:

original: dang po'i rgyu dbang byas nas kyang //🔽don gang bshad par 'gyur ba de'i //
analyzed: dang po'i rgyu dbang byas nas kyang // don gang bshad par 'gyur ba de'i //
translated: Having made the first cause the basis,🔽the activity of that🔽which is to be explained is

original: las ni de nyid kho nar gsungs //
analyzed: las ni de nyid kho nar gsungs //
translated: said to be just that.

original: lhag ma zhar las byung bar 'dod //🔽ces so // shi ba dang 'dra ba ni shi ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma zhar las byung bar 'dod // ces so // shi ba dang 'dra ba ni shi ba ste /
translated: The rest is considered to be a secondary result.

original: brgyal ba 'chi ba la mngon du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: brgyal ba 'chi ba la mngon du phyogs pa ste /
translated: “Like death” means like fainting, which is approaching death.

original: de slong ba'o //
analyzed: de slong ba'o //
translated: It is the reviving of that.

original: rdo rje'i dam tshig ni sems brgyal ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dam tshig ni sems brgyal ba ste /
translated: The vajra commitment is the fainting of the mind.

original: de gang las slong ba'o //
analyzed: de gang las slong ba'o //
translated: From what does one arouse it?

original: yang na rdo rje dam tshig ni bar do'i srid pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje dam tshig ni bar do'i srid pa'i sems so //
translated: Or else, the “vajra commitment” is the mind of the intermediate existence.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'am spyan ma'i rnal 'byor las spyan ma thabs dang bcas pa spros nas sngags 'dis bskul te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi 'am spyan ma'i rnal 'byor las spyan ma thabs dang bcas pa spros nas sngags 'dis bskul te /
translated: Having emanated Locanā together with the means from the yoga of Vairocana or Locanā, one should incite her with this mantra,

original: bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyi ngo bo bdag nyid la bcug nas zhi ba bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyi ngo bo bdag nyid la bcug nas zhi ba bya'o //
translated: and having caused her to enter one’s own nature in the form of light rays of the nature of nectar, one should perform the pacification.

original: gzhan gyi zhi ba la ni rang gi snying gar ram mdun du spyan ma dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs can bud med dang skyes pa dag sprul nas spyan ma spros te /🔽che ge mo'i zhi ba gyis shig ces pa sv'a h'a'i tshig las snga mar te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhi ba la ni rang gi snying gar ram mdun du spyan ma dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs can bud med dang skyes pa dag sprul nas spyan ma spros te / che ge mo'i zhi ba gyis shig ces pa sv'a h'a'i tshig las snga mar te /
translated: In the pacification of another, having emanated a woman or a man with the form of Locanā or Vairocana at one’s heart or in front, one should emanate Locanā,

original: sngags kyis bskul zhing snga ma bzhin du nang du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyis bskul zhing snga ma bzhin du nang du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: and with the words “Svaha” one should incite her with the mantra, “Pacify such and such,” and as before, one should cause her to enter.

original: de lta mod kyi stobs med pa mdun du @241b gnas pa nyen pa la rang gi lag pa bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer can gyis reg par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi stobs med pa mdun du @241b gnas pa nyen pa la rang gi lag pa bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin gyi 'od zer can gyis reg par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Nevertheless, one should touch with one's hand, which is the nature of nectar, the one who is powerless, who is in front, who is in danger.

original: shi ba gso ba la ni spyan ma dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs can du bud med dang skyes pa dag rang gi sa bon las bskyed de /
analyzed: shi ba gso ba la ni spyan ma dang rnam par snang mdzad kyi gzugs can du bud med dang skyes pa dag rang gi sa bon las bskyed de /
translated: In order to revive the dead, one should generate women and men, who have the form of Locana and Vairocana, from one's own seed syllable.

original: ye shes sems dpa' bcug nas /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' bcug nas /
translated: Having introduced the gnosis being,

original: de'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dang rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis sngags zlos shing bar do'i srid pa bkug nas gzhug par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dang rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis sngags zlos shing bar do'i srid pa bkug nas gzhug par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: one should recite the mantra with the light rays of its seed syllable and the light rays of one's own heart seed syllable, and summon the intermediate state being and cause it to enter.

original: gsungs pa yang zhes pa spyan ma'i nye ba'i snying po gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa yang zhes pa spyan ma'i nye ba'i snying po gnyis pa'o //
translated: The and indicates the second essence mantra of Locana.

original: chu la ni ai'o //
analyzed: chu la ni ai'o //
translated: In water is i.

original: aom gh'i sv'a h'a zhes pa m'a ma k'i'i snying po'o //
analyzed: aom gh'i sv'a h'a zhes pa m'a ma k'i'i snying po'o //
translated: Om gha hi svāhā is the essence mantra of Māmakī.

original: gh'i zhes pa gdug pa can 'joms pas srung ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gh'i zhes pa gdug pa can 'joms pas srung ba gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Gha is the illuminator of protection, since it conquers the wicked.

original: mkha' spyod ma ni aam ngo //
analyzed: mkha' spyod ma ni aam ngo //
translated: The celestial dakini is a.

original: lnga pas zhes pa ni 'don pa nyams pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pas zhes pa ni 'don pa nyams pa ste /
translated: The fifth is a corruption of the recitation.

original: bcu drug pas zhes pa ni 'don pa'o //
analyzed: bcu drug pas zhes pa ni 'don pa'o //
translated: The sixteenth is the recitation.

original: aom sham ka re sh'a nti ka re ghu ta ghu ta ghu ni gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya ghu ti ni sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sham ka re sh'a nti ka re ghu ta ghu ta ghu ni gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya ghu ti ni sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, Śaṃkara, Śāntikara, Ghūta Ghūta Ghūni Ghātaya Ghātaya Ghūti Svaha.

original: zhes pa nye ba'i snying po gcig go //
analyzed: zhes pa nye ba'i snying po gcig go //
translated: This is one essence mantra.

original: sha mu nye ba zhi ba la'o //🔽gdug pa can nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir sham ka ra'o //
analyzed: sha mu nye ba zhi ba la'o // gdug pa can nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir sham ka ra'o //
translated: Śaṃ is for Śānti, peace.🔽Śaṃkara is for Śāntika, pacifying.

original: gdug pa can nye bar zhi ba'i rjes thogs su sh'a nti ka ra'o //🔽ghu ta ni gdug pa can nyams par gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: gdug pa can nye bar zhi ba'i rjes thogs su sh'a nti ka ra'o // ghu ta ni gdug pa can nyams par gyis shig pa ste /
translated: After pacifying the wicked, there is Śāntikara.🔽Ghūta means destroy the wicked.

original: ghu ta so sor 'joms pa la'o //
analyzed: ghu ta so sor 'joms pa la'o //
translated: Ghūta is for destroying each one.

original: shin tu bskul ba'i phyir gnyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu bskul ba'i phyir gnyis brjod pa'o //
translated: It is repeated twice for the sake of strong urging.

original: ghu ti ni gdug pa can rab tu 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: ghu ti ni gdug pa can rab tu 'dul ba'o //
translated: Ghūni is for subduing the wicked.

original: sngar bzhin du che ge mo bsrung ba gyis shig ces bskul nas bsrung ba bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bzhin du che ge mo bsrung ba gyis shig ces bskul nas bsrung ba bya ste /
translated: As before, after urging, “Protect so-and-so,” one should perform the protection.

original: gdug pa can skyod par byed pa lhur len pa'i m'a ma k'i ru bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gdug pa can skyod par byed pa lhur len pa'i m'a ma k'i ru bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine Māmakī, who is intent on shaking the wicked.

original: bsrung ba ni 'chi byed la sogs pa rnams las so //
analyzed: bsrung ba ni 'chi byed la sogs pa rnams las so //
translated: Protection is from the killers, etc.

original: de kho na rdo rje mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na rdo rje mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Thatness is the indivisibility of the vajra.

original: de'i sbyor ba rnams la rtag tu sku gsum 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba rnams la rtag tu sku gsum 'grub par byed do //
translated: In the applications of that, the three bodies are always accomplished.

original: rdo rje chen po 'jigs pa ni bgegs dang log 'dren 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po 'jigs pa ni bgegs dang log 'dren 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The great vajra fear is the fear of the obstructors and the misleaders.

original: gsungs so zhes pa ni m'a ma k'i'i nye ba'i snying po gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs so zhes pa ni m'a ma k'i'i nye ba'i snying po gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second essence of Mamaki is bhyo.

original: bhyo zhes pa 'jigs par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: bhyo zhes pa 'jigs par byed pa la'o //
translated: Bhyo is for frightening.

original: gnyis pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni gos dkar mo'i'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni gos dkar mo'i'o //
translated: The second, etc. is of Pandara.

original: aom ka te bi ka te ni ka te ka tam ka te sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ka te bi ka te ni ka te ka tam ka te sv'a h'a /
translated: Om katve vika te nikate katamkate svaha.

original: zhes pa snying po ste /
analyzed: zhes pa snying po ste /
translated: This is the essence.

original: aom badzra zhes pa la sogs pa nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: aom badzra zhes pa la sogs pa nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: Om vajra, etc. is the essence.

original: ka te ni shin tu zad pa gso ba la ste /
analyzed: ka te ni shin tu zad pa gso ba la ste /
translated: Katve is for the healing of complete exhaustion.

original: ka ta dka' ba 'tsho ba la'o //
analyzed: ka ta dka' ba 'tsho ba la'o //
translated: Kata is for the difficult livelihood.

original: bi ka te ni khyad par du 'tsho bar byed pa la'o //
analyzed: bi ka te ni khyad par du 'tsho bar byed pa la'o //
translated: Vika te is for the special livelihood.

original: ni ka te sgrub pa po la nye ba la'o //
analyzed: ni ka te sgrub pa po la nye ba la'o //
translated: Nikate is for the practitioner's proximity.

original: ka tam ka te ni shin tu yang 'tsho byed la'o //
analyzed: ka tam ka te ni shin tu yang 'tsho byed la'o //
translated: Kata kata means very much, and is for Jivaka.

original: chos ni 'od dpag med @242a * //
analyzed: chos ni 'od dpag med @242a * //
translated: Dharma is Amitabha.

original: de ; de de'i gzugs can gyi don du gnyer pa po'i rgyas pa dang stobs byed cing /
analyzed: de ; de de'i gzugs can gyi don du gnyer pa po'i rgyas pa dang stobs byed cing /
translated: He is the one who expands and strengthens the one who seeks the form of that [Amitabha].

original: gos dkar mo'i gzugs can gyi yang ste /
analyzed: gos dkar mo'i gzugs can gyi yang ste /
translated: And also the form of Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: gnyis ka yang gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang gnyis ka'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because both have the nature of both.

original: shes rab dang thabs gtso bo las tha dad du bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gtso bo las tha dad du bya ba'o //
translated: Wisdom and method are to be distinguished as principal.

original: mdzod ldan ma zhes pa khyad par du mdzod rgyas pa yang ston to //
analyzed: mdzod ldan ma zhes pa khyad par du mdzod rgyas pa yang ston to //
translated: The one called Treasure-possessing shows the expansion of the treasure in particular.

original: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes pa rig pa bzlas zin pa rnams kyis rang gi sbyor ba las bzlas pa tsam gyis dngos grub tu gsungs te /
analyzed: bzlas pa tsam gyis zhes pa rig pa bzlas zin pa rnams kyis rang gi sbyor ba las bzlas pa tsam gyis dngos grub tu gsungs te /
translated: By mere recitation, it is said that those who have already recited the mantra attain accomplishment by mere recitation of their own application, saying Expand the treasure of so-and-so.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to others as well.

original: de la sngon du bsnyen pa la sngags tsam bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de la sngon du bsnyen pa la sngags tsam bzlas pa'o //
translated: There, in the preliminary approach, one recites the mantra alone.

original: rab tu sbyor ba la ni bdag gi 'am che ge mo'i rgyas par mdzod cig ces bcug pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba la ni bdag gi 'am che ge mo'i rgyas par mdzod cig ces bcug pa'o //
translated: In the application, one inserts [the mantra] saying Expand the treasure of myself or so-and-so.

original: gsung zhes pa gsung rdo rje'i tshig ni ji ltar dngos grub 'byung bar byed pa ste de ltar sgrub po'i yang ngo //🔽bcu drug pa zhes pa la sogs pa sgrol ma'i'o //
analyzed: gsung zhes pa gsung rdo rje'i tshig ni ji ltar dngos grub 'byung bar byed pa ste de ltar sgrub po'i yang ngo // bcu drug pa zhes pa la sogs pa sgrol ma'i'o //
translated: The word “speech” is the speech-vajra, which is the means of producing powers, and so it is accomplished.

original: aom t'a re tu tt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tu tt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra of Tara is “Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.”

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i phyir t'a ra sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i phyir t'a ra sgrol ma'o //
translated: She is called Tara because she delivers from the ocean of suffering.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tu tt'a ste gdung ba las sgrol lo zhes pa tu tt'a ra'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tu tt'a ste gdung ba las sgrol lo zhes pa tu tt'a ra'o //
translated: For that very reason, she is called tuttāre, which means “deliverer from distress.”

original: myur du mdzad pa'i phyir tu re ste /
analyzed: myur du mdzad pa'i phyir tu re ste /
translated: She is called ture because she acts quickly.

original: tu r'a myur ba la'o //
analyzed: tu r'a myur ba la'o //
translated: Tura means “quickly.”

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma'am don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor byas nas don yod grub pa'i gzugs su 'am 'phags ma sgrol ma'i gzugs su mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes pa'am bud med bsams te /
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma'am don yod grub pa'i rnal 'byor byas nas don yod grub pa'i gzugs su 'am 'phags ma sgrol ma'i gzugs su mngon par 'dod pa'i skyes pa'am bud med bsams te /
translated: Having performed the yoga of Noble Tara or Amoghasiddhi, one should imagine a man or woman in the form of Amoghasiddhi or Noble Tara, as one wishes.

original: rang gi snying ga nas 'phags ma sgrol ma spros nas /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga nas 'phags ma sgrol ma spros nas /
translated: One should emanate Noble Tara from one’s heart.

original: che ge mo bdag gi dbang du gyis shig ces spel te sngags zlos shing bskul bas /
analyzed: che ge mo bdag gi dbang du gyis shig ces spel te sngags zlos shing bskul bas /
translated: Reciting the mantra “Make so-and-so come under my control,” one should urge her.

original: bsgrub bya la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should cause the disciple to enter.

original: de de ltar shin tu rjes su chags shing spong ba ye shes te 'od zer gyi lcags kyus bkug pa rang ngam rang dang 'dra ba la bcug nas te /
analyzed: de de ltar shin tu rjes su chags shing spong ba ye shes te 'od zer gyi lcags kyus bkug pa rang ngam rang dang 'dra ba la bcug nas te /
translated: Having thus drawn with the hook of the light rays of the wisdom of intense attachment and abandonment, one should cause the disciple to enter into oneself or into one's equal.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dag gi dbang du skyes pa dang bud med bya ba la'o //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dag gi dbang du skyes pa dang bud med bya ba la'o //
translated: The word or indicates that one should cause a woman or a man to enter into the power of a man or a woman, respectively.

original: bud med skyes pa'i dbang du bya ba la ni rang gi bdag nyid la'am rang gi snying gar yang ngo //
analyzed: bud med skyes pa'i dbang du bya ba la ni rang gi bdag nyid la'am rang gi snying gar yang ngo //
translated: In the case of a woman or a man entering into the power of a man or a woman, one should do it either to oneself or in one's heart.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams ni skyes bu gtso bo rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams ni skyes bu gtso bo rnams so //
translated: Thus, the buddhas are the principal beings.

original: rdo rje rnams ni snying sra ba rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje rnams ni snying sra ba rnams so //
translated: The vajras are the hard hearts.

original: sde chen can ni rgyal po rnams so //
analyzed: sde chen can ni rgyal po rnams so //
translated: The great armies are the kings.

original: sems can khams ni 'jig rten thun mong ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems can khams ni 'jig rten thun mong ba rnams so //
translated: The realms of sentient beings are the common worlds.

original: kun nas ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
analyzed: kun nas ni rnam pa thams cad du'o //
translated: Everywhere means in all aspects.

original: de ltar spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha rnams gang yang rung ba sngar bzhin bsgom zhing /
analyzed: de ltar spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha rnams gang yang rung ba sngar bzhin bsgom zhing /
translated: Thus, one should meditate on any of the deities such as Locanā and so forth, as before.

original: de'i @242b sngags 'bum bsnyen pa byas nas ni /
analyzed: de'i @242b sngags 'bum bsnyen pa byas nas ni /
translated: Having recited the mantra of that deity one hundred thousand times,

original: ji skad gsungs pa bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa bya ste /
translated: One should do as it is said.

original: ji ltar rigs par sngar gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg kyang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par sngar gsungs pa'i sbyin sreg kyang ngo //
translated: Also, the previously mentioned fire sacrifice is to be done as appropriate.

original: aom yig gsal byed gang yin pa de thams cad la'o //
analyzed: aom yig gsal byed gang yin pa de thams cad la'o //
translated: The syllable Oṃ is to be placed at the beginning of all [mantras].

original: rnam dbye dang po dang mang po'i tshig ni lung ste don gcig la'o //
analyzed: rnam dbye dang po dang mang po'i tshig ni lung ste don gcig la'o //
translated: The first case [ending] and the plural are used for the scriptures, which have the same meaning.

original: sv'a h'a gang gi mtha' yin pa de'o //
analyzed: sv'a h'a gang gi mtha' yin pa de'o //
translated: The syllable svāhā is at the end of all [mantras].

original: 'di thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ji bzhin du brjod pa'i don can kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ji bzhin du brjod pa'i don can kho na ste /
translated: All of this has the meaning of expressing exactly what the Tathāgata has said.

original: ji lta bar gzhan skyes bu'i don mchog mngon par brjod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ngo zhes dman pa rnam par spro bar byed do //🔽rig pa'i rgyal po'i zhes pa /
analyzed: ji lta bar gzhan skyes bu'i don mchog mngon par brjod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ngo zhes dman pa rnam par spro bar byed do // rig pa'i rgyal po'i zhes pa /
translated: The expression the Tathāgata's speech is used to inspire the inferior, saying, Just as it is, the supreme human's expression of meaning is the Tathāgata's speech.

original: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rig ma rnams rjes su chags par byed pa'i phyir rig pa'i rgyal po ste /🔽de yang rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo la sogs pa rig ma rnams rjes su chags par byed pa'i phyir rig pa'i rgyal po ste / de yang rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The king of knowledge is Vajrasattva, because he delights the knowledge consorts such as Vajravārāhī.

original: de bsgom pa'i cho ga ni sngar rgyas par byas zin to //
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i cho ga ni sngar rgyas par byas zin to //
translated: The rite of meditating on him has been done extensively before.

original: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas de kho na 'khor lo bde mchog gi gzugs can gyi bsgom pa'i rim pa gsal zhing rdzogs pa man ngag dang bcas pa ni bdag gis byas pa'i dpal bde mchog gi mngon par rtogs pa'i cho gar rtogs par bya zhing /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan du gsungs pas de kho na 'khor lo bde mchog gi gzugs can gyi bsgom pa'i rim pa gsal zhing rdzogs pa man ngag dang bcas pa ni bdag gis byas pa'i dpal bde mchog gi mngon par rtogs pa'i cho gar rtogs par bya zhing /
translated: The clear and complete stage of meditation of the form of Cakrasaṃvara, which is taught in other tantras, together with the esoteric instructions, should be understood from my composition, the ritual of the manifest realization of Śrī Heruka.

original: bye brag rgyud 'dir gsungs pa'i mig la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa shes rab la rjes su chags pa ji srid pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' kho na'i'o //
analyzed: bye brag rgyud 'dir gsungs pa'i mig la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa shes rab la rjes su chags pa ji srid pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' kho na'i'o //
translated: The consecration of the eyes, etc., taught in this tantra, which is the passion for wisdom, is only for Vajrasattva.🔽The essence mantra is:

original: aom shr'i he he ru ru kam badzra d'a ki n'i dz'a la sa mba ram h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom shr'i he he ru ru kam badzra d'a ki n'i dz'a la sa mba ram h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ śrī he he ru ru kāya vajra dakini jālā samaṃ praṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa snying po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa snying po'o //
translated: The near essence is:

original: aom hr'i: ha ha h'um h'um phat zhes pa nye ba'i snying po ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i: ha ha h'um h'um phat zhes pa nye ba'i snying po ste / bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
translated: oṃ hrīḥ ha ha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.🔽This is for the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i ni /
translated: For the Bhagavatī, it is:🔽oṃ āḥ jñāninī hūṃ.

original: aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye buddha d'a ki n'i ye sv'a h'a zhes pa snying po dang / aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye sv'a h'a pa zhes nye ba'i snying po zhes pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye buddha d'a ki n'i ye sv'a h'a zhes pa snying po dang / aom badzra bee ro tsa n'i ye sv'a h'a pa zhes nye ba'i snying po zhes pa'o //
translated: The essence mantra is Om Vajravarnaniye Buddha dakiniye svaha, and the close essence mantra is Om Vajravarnaniye svaha.

original: gang kun du bzang po dang 'jam dpal dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang sa'i snying po dang phyag na rdo rje dang byams pa dang nam mkha'i snying po dang nam mkha' mdzod dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang spos kyi glang po dang /
analyzed: gang kun du bzang po dang 'jam dpal dang 'jig rten dbang phyug dang sa'i snying po dang phyag na rdo rje dang byams pa dang nam mkha'i snying po dang nam mkha' mdzod dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang spos kyi glang po dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas are Samantabhadra, Manjushri, Lokeshvara, Kshitigarbha, Vajrapani, Maitreya, Akashagarbha, Akashagarbha, Sarvanivarana Viskambini, and Gandhahastin.

original: blo gros mi zad pa dang / ye shes tog dang spobs pa brtsegs pa dang / mya ngan dang mun pa thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i blo gros dang ngan song kun 'joms dang dra ba can gyi 'od dang / zla ba'i 'od dang rin chen 'od dang nyi ma'i 'od dang rdo rje'o dang nor bzang dang mthu chen thob dang blo gros rgya mtsho dang bzang skyong @243a * //
analyzed: blo gros mi zad pa dang / ye shes tog dang spobs pa brtsegs pa dang / mya ngan dang mun pa thams cad nges par 'joms pa'i blo gros dang ngan song kun 'joms dang dra ba can gyi 'od dang / zla ba'i 'od dang rin chen 'od dang nyi ma'i 'od dang rdo rje'o dang nor bzang dang mthu chen thob dang blo gros rgya mtsho dang bzang skyong @243a * //
translated: Akṣayamati, Jñānaketu, Pratibhānakūṭa, Mati who definitely destroys all sorrow and darkness, Sarvanarakapratiprasrabdha, Jālinīprabha, Candraprabha, Ratnaprabha, Sūryaprabha, Vajraprabha, Sudhana, Mahāsthāmaprāpta, Sāgaramate, and Bhadrapāla.

original: rnams te byang chub sems dpa' chen po nyi shu rtsa bzhi kho na ni rim pa ji lta bar khanda ka p'a la la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams dang / de rnams kyi shes rab ma rdo rje pho nya mo dang skul byed ma dang rin chen sgrol ma dang /
analyzed: rnams te byang chub sems dpa' chen po nyi shu rtsa bzhi kho na ni rim pa ji lta bar khanda ka p'a la la sogs pa'i ngo bo rnams dang / de rnams kyi shes rab ma rdo rje pho nya mo dang skul byed ma dang rin chen sgrol ma dang /
translated: The twenty-four great bodhisattvas are, in order, the entities of Khaṇḍakapāla and so on, and their wisdom consorts are Vajra Dūtī, Cāriṇī, Ratnatārā,

original: rdo rje 'od byed ma dang ro langs ma dang rdo rje gzhon nu ma dang kam po dzi dang sangs rgyas byang chub dbang phyug ma dang / ye shes sgrol ma dang rdo rje 'jigs ma dang / g'an+ng'a r'i dang rgyal ba can ma dang sgrol ma dang gos dkar mo dang spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang /
analyzed: rdo rje 'od byed ma dang ro langs ma dang rdo rje gzhon nu ma dang kam po dzi dang sangs rgyas byang chub dbang phyug ma dang / ye shes sgrol ma dang rdo rje 'jigs ma dang / g'an+ng'a r'i dang rgyal ba can ma dang sgrol ma dang gos dkar mo dang spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang /
translated: Vajraprabhakarī, Vetālī, Vajrakumārī, Kāmbojī, Buddhabodhi, Jñānatārā, Vajraghāsinī, Gāndhārī, Jayavatī, Tārā, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Locanā, Māmakī,

original: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan ma dang so sor 'brang ma dang rma bya chen mo dang ri khrod lo ma can dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang phyir bzlog ma dang gtsug tor ma dang rdo rje 'jigs byed ma rnams rim pa ji lta bar rab tu
analyzed: rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan ma dang so sor 'brang ma dang rma bya chen mo dang ri khrod lo ma can dang rdo rje lcags sgrog ma dang phyir bzlog ma dang gtsug tor ma dang rdo rje 'jigs byed ma rnams rim pa ji lta bar rab tu
translated: Dhvajaratnā, Mahāmāyūrī, Hāṭakapāṭalā, Vajrāṅkuśī, Pracaṇḍā, Uṣṇīṣā, Vajraghorā, and so on.

original: gtum mo la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang / goo r'i dang chom rkun ma dang rmongs byed ma dang ro langs ma dang pukka s'i dang gtum mo dang gha sma r'i dang he ru ka'i 'od ma rnams kha na ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo brgyad rnams te /
analyzed: gtum mo la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang / goo r'i dang chom rkun ma dang rmongs byed ma dang ro langs ma dang pukka s'i dang gtum mo dang gha sma r'i dang he ru ka'i 'od ma rnams kha na ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa'i ngo bo brgyad rnams te /
translated: The essence of Caṇḍālī and so on are the eight goddesses Khaṇḍarohā and so on, who are at the mouths of the eight directions.

original: bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor gyi khyad par la 'di rnams kyi thabs gshin rje gshed dang rta mgrin dang bgegs mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang dbyug pa sngon po dang stobs po che dang mi g-yo ba rnams te /
analyzed: bde mchog gi dkyil 'khor gyi khyad par la 'di rnams kyi thabs gshin rje gshed dang rta mgrin dang bgegs mthar byed dang shes rab mthar byed dang 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang dbyug pa sngon po dang stobs po che dang mi g-yo ba rnams te /
translated: In the mandala of Cakrasaṃvara, these methods are the eight wrathful ones: Yamāntaka, Hayagrīva, Vighnāntaka, Prajñāntaka, Ṭakkirāja, Nīladaṇḍa, Mahābala, and Acalā.

analyzed: 'khor lo'i lte ba la t'am yig brgyad kyis bskor ba'i t'am yig gi nang du aom hr'i: che ge mo me ba shvi ku ru hr'i: sv'a h'a t'am zhes pa bris nas 'khor lo bcom ldan 'das ma'i spyi bo'i bu gnas snying gar bsgoms pa 'khor lo 'di

original: kho na la bcug nas /

analyzed: de ltar gnyis pa mar dang sbrang rtsi'i nang du gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: slar yang zhes pa rab tu dang ba'i sgrol ma bsgom pa kho na 'di ste /

analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i steng du 'khor lo rtsibs bcu pa'o //

analyzed: de'i mu khyud la aom pra sa na na zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi phreng ba bskor ba ste /

analyzed: rtsibs rnams la aom t'a re tu tt'a re sv'a h'a zhes pa'i yi ge re re'o //
translated: On the spokes are the syllables of the mantra, Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture svāhā.

analyzed: lte bar aom t'a re tu tt'a re tu re che ge mo ba sh'i ku ru sv'a h'a zhes bris nas sngar bzhin du thams cad bya'o zhes pa'o /
translated: In the center is written Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture such-and-such do this svāhā.

analyzed: ku ru ku lle'i 'khrul 'khor ni brgyad par bshad zin to //

analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes pa rdo rje ma'i rnal 'byor gyis te sngar cho ga bshad zin te /
translated: “According to the rite” means with the yoga of Vajrayoginī, as the rite was previously explained.

original: thod lo ko ri ni thod lo kor gyis so //
analyzed: thod lo ko ri ni thod lo kor gyis so //
translated: The skull is the skull cup.

original: kun du ste phyogs brgyad rnams su'o //
analyzed: kun du ste phyogs brgyad rnams su'o //

analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi dgod pa sna tshogs pa gang yin pa'i 'khor lo de ni de skad do zhes pa mdor bstan pa'o //

original: lhag ma rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: The rest is the extensive explanation.

analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa bsgom bzhin pa'i sngags pas phyogs brgyad kyi 'dab ma @246a * //
translated: The reciter who is visualizing Vajradhara should draw the wheel in the eight directions with the eight syllables.

original: can gyi padma'i lte ba la ga: yig brgyad rnams kyis bskor ba'i rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: can gyi padma'i lte ba la ga: yig brgyad rnams kyis bskor ba'i rtsibs brgyad pa'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: In the middle of the lotus of the victim, there is an eight-spoked wheel surrounded by the eight GHA syllables.

original: rtsibs so so la ga:'o zhes pa ga: yig brgyad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rtsibs so so la ga:'o zhes pa ga: yig brgyad kyis brgyan pa'o //

translated: In the middle, too, in the middle of the wheel, there is a GHA surrounded by the eight GHA syllables.

analyzed: thun mtshams so sor rkang pas mnan nas brgyad lhag pa'i brgyar ga: che ge mo sta mbha ya sv'a h'a ga: zhes bzlas te gzhag par bya'o zhes pa cho ga'o //
translated: At each watch, having pressed down with the foot, one should recite one hundred and eight times, “GHA so-and-so STAMBHAYA SVĀHĀ GHA,” and place it. This is the rite.

original: de nyid ces pa de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa de ma thag pa'o //
translated: “That very” is the immediately preceding.

original: ga: yig rnams kyi gnas su h'um h'um phat do //
analyzed: ga: yig rnams kyi gnas su h'um h'um phat do //
translated: In the place of the GHA syllables, there are HŪM HŪM PHAṬ.

original: khrag ni sdigs mdzub kyi'o ;
analyzed: khrag ni sdigs mdzub kyi'o ;
translated: Blood is from the threatening forefinger.

original: / thod pa khu sbub pa rkang pas mnan nas /
analyzed: / thod pa khu sbub pa rkang pas mnan nas /
translated: Having pressed down with the foot, the skull is the hollow of the foot.

original: h'um h'um phat che ge mo m'a ra ya sv'a h'a h'um h'um phat ces pa thun so sor brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: h'um h'um phat che ge mo m'a ra ya sv'a h'a h'um h'um phat ces pa thun so sor brgya rtsa brgyad du bzlas nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: HUM HUM PHAṬ.  CHA GE MO MA RA YA SVĀHĀ.  HUM HUM PHAṬ.  Having recited this mantra one hundred and eight times for each of the three periods of the day, one should place it.

original: de kho na zhes pa 'khor lo dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na zhes pa 'khor lo dgod pa'o //

original: ga: yig gi gnas su aom aom che ge mo rgyas par mdzod cig sv'a h'a aom zhes bzlas nas gzhag par bya'o ;

analyzed: phat yig rnams la sngon du che ge mo m'a ra ya zhes pa la sogs pa ldan pa rnams @249a * //

analyzed: so ; / de rnams kyi nang du rdza rnga'i rnam pa'i 'khor lo re mig bzhi bcu rtsa dgu pa can te /
translated: Among those, there is a wheel in the form of a clay drum with forty-nine squares.🔽Beginning with the square of the face, as long as there is an inner square, the forty-nine letters completely surround it like a coiled snake.

original: gdong gi re mig nas brtsams pa nang gi re mig ji srid par sbrul 'khyil ba bzhin yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgus yongs su bskor ba las kyi rjes su 'brang bas bri'o //
analyzed: gdong gi re mig nas brtsams pa nang gi re mig ji srid par sbrul 'khyil ba bzhin yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa dgus yongs su bskor ba las kyi rjes su 'brang bas bri'o //
translated: One should draw it following the procedure.

original: de la shin tu dpa' ba'i mtsho skyes kyi snad gnyis rlon par ram /
analyzed: de la shin tu dpa' ba'i mtsho skyes kyi snad gnyis rlon par ram /
translated: There, the two eyes of the ocean born one are very courageous, either fresh or🔽dried by a brahman.

original: bram ze'i skam por dug dang khrag dang tsandra'i sa bon thod par gnas pa rnams kyis mi'i rus pa'i 'bri smyug gis bris te /
analyzed: bram ze'i skam por dug dang khrag dang tsandra'i sa bon thod par gnas pa rnams kyis mi'i rus pa'i 'bri smyug gis bris te /
translated: In a skull that is filled with poison, blood, and the seeds of candali, one should draw it with a human bone pen.

original: bcu pa'am bcu bzhi pa la mi sha'i gtor ma byin nas /
analyzed: bcu pa'am bcu bzhi pa la mi sha'i gtor ma byin nas /
translated: On the tenth or the fourteenth, one should offer a human flesh bali.

original: gos sngon po can gshin rje'i phyogs su kha bltas pas /
analyzed: gos sngon po can gshin rje'i phyogs su kha bltas pas /
translated: One should face the direction of Yama while wearing blue clothes.

original: thod pa gnyis sbyar ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis kyi dbus su bsgrub bya bsams nas spel tshig dang bcas pa'i sngags zlos shing lag pa g-yas pas gzung ba'i rdo rjes yang yang du brdegs pas 'jig par byed do //
analyzed: thod pa gnyis sbyar ba'i 'khrul 'khor gnyis kyi dbus su bsgrub bya bsams nas spel tshig dang bcas pa'i sngags zlos shing lag pa g-yas pas gzung ba'i rdo rjes yang yang du brdegs pas 'jig par byed do //
translated: Having visualized the victim in the center of two yantras with two skull cups joined together, one destroys him by reciting the mantra with the addition of the name, and by striking him again and again with a vajra held in the right hand.

original: de bzhin kho nar ma he dang rta'i thod pa dag tu bris nas /
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar ma he dang rta'i thod pa dag tu bris nas /
translated: In the same way, having written on the skull cups of a buffalo and a horse,

original: 'khrul 'khor gyi dbus su bsgrub bya rta dang ma he la zhon pa phan tshun mtshon 'debs pa dag bsams nas sngags bzlas pas sdang bar byed do //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyi dbus su bsgrub bya rta dang ma he la zhon pa phan tshun mtshon 'debs pa dag bsams nas sngags bzlas pas sdang bar byed do //
translated: and having visualized the victim mounted on a horse and a buffalo, mutually striking each other with weapons, in the center of the yantras, one causes enmity by reciting the mantra.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi rjes su 'brang bas ni 'khor lo gro ga la sogs pa la rnam pa gnyis bris nas kha sbyor du byas te rjes su mthun pa'i skud pas dkris pa za ma tog la sogs par bzhag nas mchod de bzlas pas mngon
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi rjes su 'brang bas ni 'khor lo gro ga la sogs pa la rnam pa gnyis bris nas kha sbyor du byas te rjes su mthun pa'i skud pas dkris pa za ma tog la sogs par bzhag nas mchod de bzlas pas mngon
translated: Following the rite of pacification, etc., one writes the two forms of the mantra on birch bark, etc., and having joined them together, one wraps them with a thread of the appropriate color, and having placed them in a box, etc., one worships them and recites the mantra.

original: par 'dod pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: par 'dod pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: One accomplishes the desired aim.

original: 'dir ni 'khor lo 'di 'di ltar dgod pa kho nas gnon pa dang / bcing ba dang rmongs pa dang ltung ba dang / rmugs pa dang / bye zhing sdang ba dang / skrod pa dang / zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang rengs pa dang dgug pa rnams 'grub bo zhes 'doms so //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'khor lo 'di 'di ltar dgod pa kho nas gnon pa dang / bcing ba dang rmongs pa dang ltung ba dang / rmugs pa dang / bye zhing sdang ba dang / skrod pa dang / zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang dbang dang rengs pa dang dgug pa rnams 'grub bo zhes 'doms so //
translated: Here, it is taught that by merely setting out this wheel in this way, one will accomplish subduing, binding, stupefying, casting down, paralyzing, causing enmity, expelling, pacifying, enriching, controlling, and paralyzing.

original: dgod pa gzhan ni gdul bya rnam pa sna tshogs pa las gzhan du gsungs so //
analyzed: dgod pa gzhan ni gdul bya rnam pa sna tshogs pa las gzhan du gsungs so //
translated: Other settings are taught for the various types of disciples.

original: 'dir 'di ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: Here, this is the yoga of total victory over the three worlds.

original: 'gro ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i ched du bgegs med par bya'o zhes bsams nas /
analyzed: 'gro ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i ched du bgegs med par bya'o zhes bsams nas /
translated: Thinking, “I will do this in order to attain the state of Vajradhara,”

original: yud kyis stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i rjes thogs su sna tshogs chu skyes dang / nyi ma la gnas pa'i bhr'um las skyes pa'i 'khor lo ser po g-yon skor du 'khor ba rtsibs bcu pa'i lte ba'i dbus kyi nang du bdag nyid h'um yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad du bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: yud kyis stong pa nyid bsgoms pa'i rjes thogs su sna tshogs chu skyes dang / nyi ma la gnas pa'i bhr'um las skyes pa'i 'khor lo ser po g-yon skor du 'khor ba rtsibs bcu pa'i lte ba'i dbus kyi nang du bdag nyid h'um yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad du bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Immediately after meditating on emptiness, one should meditate on oneself as Humkara Vajrapani, arisen from a Bhur that is on a variegated lotus and sun, in the center of the nave of a yellow wheel with ten spokes, turning counterclockwise.

original: 'di'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan la @249b sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs par rnam par phye'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sku mdog dang phyag mtshan la @249b sogs pa rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs par rnam par phye'o //
translated: His color, implements, and so forth are distinguished in the Vajrasattva-abhisamaya.

original: de'i snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i khro bo'i tshogs shes rab kyi padma las spro'o //
analyzed: de'i snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i khro bo'i tshogs shes rab kyi padma las spro'o //
translated: The assembly of wrathful deities summoned by the light rays from the seed syllable in his heart are emanated from the wisdom lotus.

original: de la shar gyi rtsibs la rdo rje dbyug pa sngon po rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal rnams sngon po dang ser po dang ljang gu can /
analyzed: de la shar gyi rtsibs la rdo rje dbyug pa sngon po rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal rnams sngon po dang ser po dang ljang gu can /
translated: On the eastern spoke is Vajra-Danda, with blue, yellow, and green faces on the right and left.

original: phyag g-yas pa dag na rdo rje tho ba dang rdo rje phyar ba'i sdigs mdzub /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa dag na rdo rje tho ba dang rdo rje phyar ba'i sdigs mdzub /
translated: In his right hands he holds a vajra hammer and a vajra threatening mudra.

original: g-yon dag na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga can no //
analyzed: g-yon dag na thod pa dang kha tv'am ga can no //
translated: In his left [hands] he holds a skull and khaṭvāṅga.

original: byang du nyi ma'i me ser po ser po dang sngon po dang ljang gu'i zhal can rdo rje dbyug pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: byang du nyi ma'i me ser po ser po dang sngon po dang ljang gu'i zhal can rdo rje dbyug pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the north is Yellow Sun-fire, with yellow, blue, and green faces, holding a vajra and club.

original: phyag mtshan gzhan snga ma bzhin 'di phyi ma rnams la yang ngo //🔽nub tu rdo rje gtsug tor dmar po dang dkar po dang ljang gu'i zhal can phyag na padma dmar po'o //
analyzed: phyag mtshan gzhan snga ma bzhin 'di phyi ma rnams la yang ngo // nub tu rdo rje gtsug tor dmar po dang dkar po dang ljang gu'i zhal can phyag na padma dmar po'o //
translated: The other hand implements are the same as before. This is also the case for the following deities.🔽In the west is Red Vajroṣṇīṣa, with red, white, and green faces, holding a red lotus in his hands.

original: lhor rdo rje 'khyil pa ljang gu ljang gu dang ser po dang dkar po'i zhal can /
analyzed: lhor rdo rje 'khyil pa ljang gu ljang gu dang ser po dang dkar po'i zhal can /
translated: In the south is Green Vajra-Aṅkuśa, with green, yellow, and white faces.

original: phyag sna tshogs rdo rjes spras pa'o //
analyzed: phyag sna tshogs rdo rjes spras pa'o //
translated: His hands are marked with various vajras.

original: me'i phyogs su rdo rje gnod sbyin du ba'i mdog can /
analyzed: me'i phyogs su rdo rje gnod sbyin du ba'i mdog can /
translated: In the fire direction is Vajrayakṣa, the color of smoke,

original: du ba dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: du ba dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: with smoky, yellow, and green faces, holding a goad.

original: srin po'i mtshams su rdo rje dus dmar po dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can phyag na dgra sta'o //
analyzed: srin po'i mtshams su rdo rje dus dmar po dmar po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can phyag na dgra sta'o //
translated: In the rākṣasa direction is Red Vajra-Kāla, with red, yellow, and green faces, holding a club in his hands.

original: rlung mtshams su stobs po che sngon po //
analyzed: rlung mtshams su stobs po che sngon po //
translated: In the wind quarter, blue Mahābala,

original: sngon po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can /
translated: with blue, yellow, and green faces,

original: phyag na rtse gsum pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rtse gsum pa'o //
translated: holding a trident.

original: dbang ldan phyogs su rdo rje 'jigs su rung ba nag po mi g-yo ba nag po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can phyag na ral gri'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan phyogs su rdo rje 'jigs su rung ba nag po mi g-yo ba nag po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can phyag na ral gri'o //
translated: In the northeast quarter, black Vajrabhairava, with black, yellow, and green faces, holding a sword.

original: steng du gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dkar po dkar po dang sngon po dang ljang gu'i zhal can /
analyzed: steng du gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba dkar po dkar po dang sngon po dang ljang gu'i zhal can /
translated: Above, white Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin, with white, blue, and green faces,

original: phyag na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: phyag na 'khor lo'o //
translated: holding a wheel.

original: 'og tu gnod mdzes rdo rje sngon po //
analyzed: 'og tu gnod mdzes rdo rje sngon po //
translated: Below, blue Sumbha Vajra,

original: sngon po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can rdo rje gtun shing gis rol pa'i phyag can te /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang ljang gu'i zhal can rdo rje gtun shing gis rol pa'i phyag can te /
translated: with blue, yellow, and green faces, with hands playing a vajra and pestle,

original: 'di'i g-yon pa na ni klu'i zhags pa sdigs mdzub can dang kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: 'di'i g-yon pa na ni klu'i zhags pa sdigs mdzub can dang kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: with a snake noose and threatening gesture in the left.

original: 'di rnams thams cad kyang phyag mtshan gtso bo dang thod pas mtshan pa'i phyag dag gis rang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad kyang phyag mtshan gtso bo dang thod pas mtshan pa'i phyag dag gis rang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: All of them have the principal hand emblems and skull-cups, and they embrace wisdom consorts similar to themselves.

original: dpu skra dmar ser 'bar zhing gyen du 'khyil ba /
analyzed: dpu skra dmar ser 'bar zhing gyen du 'khyil ba /
translated: His orange hair bristles upward.

original: rang gi rigs kyi mgon pos mchog tu gsal ba'i dbu rgyan can /🔽smin ma dang khro gnyer dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi mgon pos mchog tu gsal ba'i dbu rgyan can / smin ma dang khro gnyer dang bcas pa /
translated: He is adorned with a crest ornament of the lord of his family.🔽He has eyebrows and a frown.

original: mche ba gtsigs pa'i zhal can rnams te /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa'i zhal can rnams te /
translated: He has a face with bared fangs.

original: zhal so so la dmar la zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: zhal so so la dmar la zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /
translated: Each face has three eyes, red and round.

original: mi mgo'i phreng ba dang 'khor lo can dang rna cha la sogs pa'i rgyan can /
analyzed: mi mgo'i phreng ba dang 'khor lo can dang rna cha la sogs pa'i rgyan can /
translated: He is adorned with ornaments such as a garland of human heads, a wheel, and earrings.

original: rgyan gyi klu'i rgyal po brgyad kyis phut yig phyogs kyi sgor sgrogs pa can /
analyzed: rgyan gyi klu'i rgyal po brgyad kyis phut yig phyogs kyi sgor sgrogs pa can /
translated: The eight nāga kings of the ornaments proclaim the syllable pūṃ at the gates of the directions.

original: sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma rnams la @250a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs chu skyes dang nyi ma rnams la @250a * //
translated: On variegated lotuses and suns,

original: phyogs skyong ba brgyad rnams dang steng du tshangs pa dang 'og tu thags bzangs ris g-yas brkyang gi stabs kyis mnan nas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs skyong ba brgyad rnams dang steng du tshangs pa dang 'og tu thags bzangs ris g-yas brkyang gi stabs kyis mnan nas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the eight directional guardians are above, Brahmā, and below, Virūpākṣa, are pressed down with his right leg extended.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba 'khrigs 'jigs pa //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba 'khrigs 'jigs pa //
translated: The blazing vajra is terrifying,

original: phyogs bcu rnams su 'phro mdzad pa //
analyzed: phyogs bcu rnams su 'phro mdzad pa //
translated: radiating in the ten directions.

original: bka' yi 'khor lo 'dis myur bar //
analyzed: bka' yi 'khor lo 'dis myur bar //
translated: This wheel of command is swift,

original: 'gro ba rnams la bgegs med mdzad //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams la bgegs med mdzad //
translated: He acts without obstruction for the sake of beings.

original: ces so // de skad du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // de skad du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also said:

original: dpal ldan rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi //
translated: The glorious Vajra Humkara

original: 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i rnal 'byor bdag nyid kyi //
translated: is the essence of the wheel yoga.

original: rdza rnga'i las gsungs dngos grub ni //
analyzed: rdza rnga'i las gsungs dngos grub ni //
translated: The powers taught in the drum

original: kun gyi 'bras bu byung ba brtsam //
analyzed: kun gyi 'bras bu byung ba brtsam //
translated: are the fruit of all that has arisen.

original: zhes so // 'khor lo 'di yang rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa 'dir bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'khor lo 'di yang rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa 'dir bshad pa ste /
translated: This wheel is taught in other tantras and is explained here.

original: sngags gsungs pa las so //
analyzed: sngags gsungs pa las so //
translated: It is from the teaching of the mantra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams 'dir 'brel par nye bar 'gro'o zhes pa man ngag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams 'dir 'brel par nye bar 'gro'o zhes pa man ngag go //
translated: Therefore, the yoga and yogini tantras such as the Shriparamādya are related to this tantra. This is the esoteric instruction.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i lha rnams kyang 'dir bsgom par bya ba 'grub po zhes gsal bar byas so //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i lha rnams kyang 'dir bsgom par bya ba 'grub po zhes gsal bar byas so //
translated: For this very reason, the deities taught in other tantras are also accomplished in this meditation. This is made clear.

original: de ltar na yang rgyud 'di ni lha thams cad pa kho na'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rgyud 'di ni lha thams cad pa kho na'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it is said that this tantra is indeed for all deities.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad gtso bo can srung ba'i 'khor lo 'di'am rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad gtso bo can srung ba'i 'khor lo 'di'am rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs par brjod pa ni /
translated: This is the protection wheel with Vajrahūṃkāra as the principal figure, or the description of the realization of Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir g-yon skor du bsgoms nas /
analyzed: 'dir g-yon skor du bsgoms nas /
translated: Here, one should meditate in a counterclockwise direction,

original: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'i sngags de bskul ba'i bsam pa can gyis /
analyzed: gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba'i sngags de bskul ba'i bsam pa can gyis /
translated: and with the thought of inciting the mantra of Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin,

original: gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gam brgya rtsa brgyad du gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig gam brgya rtsa brgyad du gdon par bya ste /
translated: one should recite it three, seven, twenty-one, or one hundred and eight times.

original: de lta kho nar khro bo bcu'i sngags rnams yang na'o //
analyzed: de lta kho nar khro bo bcu'i sngags rnams yang na'o //
translated: In the same way, one should recite the mantras of the ten wrathful ones.

original: de la / aom kha badzra dhri ka badzra h'um ka ra badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: de la / aom kha badzra dhri ka badzra h'um ka ra badzra h'um phat /
translated: There, (1) Oṃ khavajra-dhṛk vajra-hūṃkāra vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,

original: aom badzra da nda badzra h'um phat /🔽aom badzra aa na l'a rka badzra h'um phat /🔽aom badzra au shn'i sha badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra da nda badzra h'um phat / aom badzra aa na l'a rka badzra h'um phat / aom badzra au shn'i sha badzra h'um phat /
translated: (2) Oṃ vajra-daṇḍa vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,🔽(3) Oṃ vajra-anala-arka vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,🔽(4) Oṃ vajra-uṣṇīṣa vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,

original: aom badzra ku nda li badzra h'um phat /🔽aom badzra ya ksha badzra h'um phat /🔽aom badzra k'a la badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra ku nda li badzra h'um phat / aom badzra ya ksha badzra h'um phat / aom badzra k'a la badzra h'um phat /
translated: (5) Oṃ vajra-kuṇḍali vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,🔽(6) Oṃ vajra-yakṣa vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,🔽(7) Oṃ vajra-kāla vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,

original: aom badzra ma h'a b'a la badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra ma h'a b'a la badzra h'um phat /
translated: (8) Oṃ vajra-mahābala vajra-hūṃ phaṭ,

original: aom badzra bhi sha na badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra bhi sha na badzra h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-bhiṣaṇa vajra hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra au shn'i sha tsa kra wa rti badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra au shn'i sha tsa kra wa rti badzra h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-uṣṇīṣa cakravarti vajra hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom badzra p'a t'a la badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra p'a t'a la badzra h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra-pāśa vajra hūṃ phaṭ.

original: ces pa rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: ces pa rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i sngags so //
translated: These are the mantras of Vajrahūṃkāra and so forth.

original: de ltar goms nas thun bzhir rjes su bsgrub pa la glags tshol ba rnams kyi rjes su bsam pa nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar goms nas thun bzhir rjes su bsgrub pa la glags tshol ba rnams kyi rjes su bsam pa nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, having become familiar with that, in the four periods of the day and night, the one who is intent on the subsequent practice will be unable to be harmed by those who seek an opportunity.

original: phyi rol de rnams kho na la las la gnod pa las ltung ngo zhes pa bsgom bya'i phyir zlog 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol de rnams kho na la las la gnod pa las ltung ngo zhes pa bsgom bya'i phyir zlog 'di gsungs so //
translated: In order to cultivate the thought that those external ones are just the objects of one’s karma, this reversal is taught:

original: gzhan gyi ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes thogs su /
